section.name: Overview
section.p: This project was built in order to provide a better handling of decimals that is provided in the standard Java library, in particular to support handling of monetary values in a financial application.
Java provides support for Decimals in two ways.

dl.dd: Decimals can be represented as float/double. However adding two floats together is a notoriously unreliable method and provides some shocking results for the unwary (see article)
This provides accurate and predictable results, but is slow due to the fact that BigDecimal is immutable

section.p: The aim of this project is to provide a cut down BigDecimal object that is not immutable and hence is more appropriate for usage in financial applications
